title: Ticket #1378: force-auth commands broken when security negotiation off
description:
When SEC_DEFAULT_NEGOTIATION=NEVER or anything equivalent that causes security negotiation not to happen, DaemonCore rejects commands that are registered with force_authentication=true.

The fix that Zach and I agreed on is to make DaemonCore do the authentication for the incoming connection.

This means that we can eventually remove all of the server-side code that does authentication in the command-handler of commands that are registered with force_authentication=true. It would be nice to also remove the client-side code that does the authentication in the command protocol and instead have it done inside of startCommand(). This would either require passing an argument to startCommand() or having built-in knowledge about which commands always require authentication.
